Tonga: The first Christian missionaries arrived from London.
Malta: By a Papal brief dated 3 March 1797, Bishop Vincenzo Labini and all his successors in the diocese of Malta, were given the title of 'Bishop of Malta and Archbishop of Rhodes'. This privilege was suppressed in 1928, and the title was changed to 'Archbishop, Bishop of Malta'.
Haiti: Sonthonax appointed Toussaint the commander-in-chief of the French colonial forces.
Germany: Frederick William III of Prussia became king of Prussia.
France: War of the First Coalition – The Treaty of Campo Formio is signed between France and Austria following decisive French military victories. The treaty marks the collapse of the First Coalition, composed of European powers which tried to contain Revolutionary France.
Colombia: Pedro Mendinueta y Múzquiz is Viceroy of New Granada
Burma: Burmese invasion of Lan Na and Luang Prabang fails
Belgium: Suppression of religious life begins in earnest.
By the Treaty of Campo Formio the Austrian monarchy accepts the French annexation of the former Austrian Netherlands.
Australia: Sydney Cove was wrecked and some survivors travelled from Bass Strait to Port Jackson, enabling the rescue of others. This also furthered knowledge of the geography of Australia.
